metadata.titleEn: GEOCHRONOLOGICAL and geochemical characteristics of sigongshan pluton in Dabie orogenic belt and its Mesozoic geodynamic database
metadata.description:
Data includes excel and JPG format. Excel data includes: Zircon chronology data, whole rock major and trace element analysis data, whole rock strontium and neodymium isotope analysis data, zircon hafnium isotope analysis data.
Laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) was used for zircon dating in the school of resources and environmental engineering, Hefei University of technology, China.
The major and trace elements of the whole rock were measured in ALS laboratory group (Australian ICP-MS analysis laboratory in Guangzhou, China). The main elements were determined by X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (XRF). Determination of trace elements by ICP-MS on element-2 mass spectrometer
RB – Sr and SM – Nd isotope measurements were carried out on the Finnigan mat ‐ 262 thermal ionization mass spectrometer (TIMS) of University of science and technology of China.
The State Key Laboratory of geological processes and mineral resources of China University of Geosciences has carried out in-situ Hf isotope analysis on zircon grains, which have been dated by la-icp-ms.
The data in JPG format include: (1) geological map of Dabie orogenic belt showing the distribution of Early Cretaceous rocks; (2) geological map of sigongshan area in central Dabie; (3) microscopic image of magmatic rocks of sks intrusion (cross polarized light) (a) quartz diorite (14sk003-1); (4) quartz diorite (14sk003-1); (4) quartz diorite (14sk003-1); (4) quartz diorite (14sk003-1);
Four representative zircon cathodoluminescence (CL) images of sks intrusions 5. Zircon u – Pb concordance of sks intrusions 6. Classification of sks intrusions; Harker diagram of sks intrusive magmatic rocks
9. Rb-v of magmatic rocks of sks intrusion. 10 SR – Nd isotopic composition of sks intrusion data source: 11 zircon U-Pb age and age. ε HF (T) diagram of sks intrusive magmatic rocks: 12 (LA / Yb) n-sr / y diagram of sks intrusive magmatic rocks; 13 EU and Sr (a) and EU and Rb (b) diagram of quartz diorite and monzonitic granite in sks intrusion; 14 y and Sr / y fractional crystallization (FC) model
Based on the above data, we can analyze the monzogranite and quartz diorite in sigongshan pluton, the largest pluton in the central Dabie unit of Dabie orogenic belt, and provide evidence for their movement analysis in Mesozoic geodynamics.
metadata.instructions: File name: the sample data number is composed of, and the file name is "yyddbb", where YY represents the sampling year, DD represents the specific sampling location, and BB represents the sample number.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific features of the data collection methods used for analyzing zircon dating in geological studies?
Feature Specification.Answer: laser ablation, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, precise age determination

Quantification.Question: How many types of isotopic measurements are conducted in the data collection methods related to the field?

Definition.Question: What is meant by '锆石定年分析' in the context of geochemical and geochronological studies?
Definition.Answer: '锆石定年分析' refers to zircon dating analysis, a method used in geochemical and geochronological studies to determine the age of zircon minerals found in rock formations. In this context, it involves using techniques such as laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) to analyze the age of zircon particles, which helps in understanding the geological history and processes of an area.

Interpretation.Question: What geological insights can be inferred from the patterns observed in the zircon U-Pb age and εHf(t) values in a dataset on igneous rock formations?
Interpretation.Answer: By analyzing the zircon U-Pb age and εHf(t) values, researchers can infer the timing of magmatic events and the source characteristics of the magma. In the context of the Dabie Orogenic Belt, these patterns can provide evidence for understanding the tectonic processes during the Mesozoic era and the origins of the quartz diorite and monzogranite in the Sigungshan pluton.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential consequences on the accuracy of geochronological analysis if multiple data collection methods, such as LA-ICP-MS and TIMS, are integrated into a dataset for studying the Mesozoic geodynamics of the Dabie orogeny?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Integrating multiple data collection methods like LA-ICP-MS for zircon dating and TIMS for isotopic measurements in a dataset can enhance the accuracy of geochronological analysis by providing cross-validation of results and capturing different isotopic nuances. This combination allows for a more comprehensive understanding of the age and isotopic compositions, leading to more precise interpretations of the Mesozoic geodynamics in the Dabie orogeny.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the purpose of collecting zircon age data and analyzing isotopic compositions in geological studies of the Dabie orogeny?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The purpose of collecting zircon age data and analyzing isotopic compositions is to provide evidence for analyzing and studying the granodiorite and quartz diorite in the Sigongshan pluton, the largest plutonic body in the central Dabie unit, and to offer insights into the geodynamic movements during the Mesozoic era.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What instrumental methods and procedures are utilized to collect and analyze zircon U-Pb and Hf isotopic data for geochronological studies in geological research?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Zircon U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic analysis are conducted using LA-ICP-MS for zircon dating and in-situ Hf isotopic analysis on zircon grains. The LA-ICP-MS technique is used for zircon dating at the School of Resources and Environmental Engineering, while in-situ Hf isotopic analysis is performed at the State Key Laboratory of Geological Processes and Mineral Resources, China University of Geosciences.
